Sure, here are some popular tea houses and shrines to visit in Kyoto:

Tea Houses:
1. Camellia Tea Ceremony: Located in the historic geisha district of Gion, offers tea ceremonies in English and Japanese.
2. En Tea Ceremony: Offers a luxurious tea experience in a serene and private setting with a beautiful garden view.

Shrines:
1. Fushimi Inari Taisha: One of the most famous and popular shrines in Kyoto, known for its thousands of vermilion torii gates lining the trails up to its sacred mountain, Inari.
2. Kiyomizudera Temple: A UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the most iconic temples in Kyoto, with a stunning view of the city from its wooden deck.
3. Shimogamo Shrine: A serene and lush forest shrine known for its ancient power spot, Kamomioya-jinsha, which is said to offer blessings for love and relationships. 

These are just a few of the many tea houses and shrines worth visiting in Kyoto. Always be sure to check their hours of operation and any necessary admission fees before you visit.
